Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parser : Encapsulates access to the input code. Reads an assembly language command, parses it, and provides convenient access to the commands components (fields and symbols). In addition, removes all white space and comments. Done with : constructor() dest() advance() getCurrentCommand() hasMoreCommands() parseCommandsType() cleanLine() comp() jump() symbol()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Parser()
      Constructor that initializes a table of allowed characters and fills it up.
      Parser(java.lang.String inputFileName)
      Constructor that opens the input file/stream and parses it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Parser

        public Parser(java.lang.String inputFileName)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor that opens the input file/stream and parses it. Also initializes table of allowed characters and fills it up.
        Parameters:
        inputFileName - The name of the file to be opened and parsed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Will throw an I.O.exception if the file cannot be opened.

      • Parser

        public Parser()
        Constructor that initializes a table of allowed characters and fills it up. This is a blank constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • symbol

        public java.lang.String symbol()
        Method that returns the symbol or decimal xxx of the current command @xxx or (xxx). Should be called only when commandType() is A_command or L_command.
        Returns:
        -Either a label or variable.

      • jump

        public java.lang.String jump()
        Method that returns the dest mnemonic in the current C-command (8-possibilities). Should be called only when commandType is C.
        Returns:
        Returns a string with the mnemonic of jump. JLT JEQ JGT JLE JNE JGE JMP

      • dest

        public java.lang.String dest()
        Method that returns the dest mnemonic in the current C-command (8-possibilities). Should be called only when commandType is C.
        Returns:
        Returns a string with the mnemonic.

      • comp

        public java.lang.String comp()
        Method that returns the comp mnemonic in the current C-command (8-possibilities). Should be called only when commandType is C.
        Returns:
        Returns a string with the mnemonic that represents a comp.

      • advance

        public void advance()
             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Method that is used to move the scanner aka the programs current command to the next one if possible.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Throws a RuntimeException if an invalid character is used.

      • getCurrentCommand

        public java.lang.String getCurrentCommand()
        Method that gets the current raw and unfiltered command.
        Returns:
        Returns the current command.

      • hasMoreCommands

        public boolean hasMoreCommands()
        A method that checks to see if the file being parsed has any further commands to process.
        Returns:
        returns true if a next line is present, returns false if no next line is present.

      • parseCommandType

        public char parseCommandType(java.lang.String clean)
        Helper Method that determines the command type. Can either be an A instruction, C instruction,or a label.
        Parameters:
        clean - The cleaned line of assembly that is to be parsed for command type.
        Returns:
        Returns a char indicating what type of command it is. If the method cannot detect what type of command it is, it will return 0. A - a instruction. C - c instruction. L - a label.

      • commandType

        public char commandType()
        Method that determines the command type of the current command stored in the parameter current command. Can either be an A instruction, C instruction,or a label.
        Returns:
        Returns a char indicating what type of command it is. If the method cannot detect what type of command it is, it will return 0. A - a instruction. C - c instruction. L - a label.

      • isValidCharacter

        public boolean isValidCharacter(char characterToEvaluate)
        Helper method that checks to see if the character is in the valid array.
        Parameters:
        characterToEvaluate - The character that is to be checked to see if it exist in allowed characters.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the character is allowed and false if not.
